Posts.Content: Hi, Had a lumpectomy on the 7th December2017 and now I am on my 17 out of my 19 rad treatments and no side effect yet.    Don't regret my decision at all.    Had stage 1 cancer on the left breast. Wishing you all the best on the 7th of March.  Keep us posted Charlene70 xxx
Posts.Title: Anyone refused radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Mistymoley, thanks for your help.   That a good idea, will meet with my Gp and have some more blood tests. Thanks again, Charlene70
Posts.Title: tamoxifen(Nolvadex-d) and hair lost - need comments please

Posts.Content: Hi BiBi So glad you are giving me all these informations.  Will have a look into it before going to my oncologist. I was giving up the Tamoxifen because I was so discouraged of the effects on me. Will have a look at all the information you have given me and re-think things over. Thanks again, really do appreciate. P.s.:  sorry for my grammar, I am French from Canada and sometime it is not very good grammar. Hugs Charlene
Posts.Title: tamoxifen(Nolvadex-d) and hair lost - need comments please

Posts.Content: Thanks for your post Jacmaholmad, you say you have thick hair, you are very lucky in a way.   Mine was fine hair so any lost shows immediately. Will keep you posted. Charlene70 hug
Posts.Title: tamoxifen(Nolvadex-d) and hair lost - need comments please

Posts.Content: Hi everyone...     Does anyone else have had hair lost with (Nolvadex-d) Tamoxifen. I have been on this brand name for 3 months now and my hair is falling out. Worst nightmare for me.      Anybody out there have the same problem. Please let me know or gave me some advice on your own experience. Charlene70
Posts.Title: tamoxifen(Nolvadex-d) and hair lost - need comments please

Posts.Content: Hi BiBi 44,   Thanks for you post it did give me a clue.   I have 20mg pills  on Nolvadex-D..... will try to have it changed to 10Mg....  to see if it does change something with my hair lost.    Right now I am taking a brake from Tamoxifen....  Please let me know if you have the same brand name as me.  (Nolvadex-D). Again thank you so much.  Charlene70 Hug
Posts.Title: tamoxifen(Nolvadex-d) and hair lost - need comments please

Posts.Content: Hi there, Thank for your info   I will take tamoxiflen for sure.  Don't want to go back to taking another chance for a secondary cancer.   But i like to know before I take these pills all information on side effects and also on the Brand name of the pill you are taking.  Because i have to discuss this with my pharmacist and I know they can easily change the brand name from one month to another.   That is wHat I will be watching. Have you been on the same brand for the beginning? Thanks for letting me know, Charlene70 xxxx
Posts.Title: I am all mixed up - what's the difference between Letrozole and Tamoxifen...

Posts.Content: Hi jojoboobs, My treatments are finished sind the 21 of February.  I had 19 rad sessions.  All went well and now I am in the process to take Tamoxiflen, just need to see my pharmacist to see what kind of brand name he has on hand. Hope  you are doing well with your rad sessions. Take care Charlene xxr

Posts.Title: I am all mixed up - what's the difference between Letrozole and Tamoxifen...

Posts.Content: Hi everyone, Tamoxif I was prescribed tamoxifen to take after my rad sessions (just finish them last Wednesday).  I am now in the process of starting Tamoxifen but after searching on this site and others... I am not so sure to take it.  The effects of this pills seems so bad. All you comments and help in this matter would be greatly appreciate. Thank you all Charlene70
Posts.Title: I am all mixed up - what's the difference between Letrozole and Tamoxifen...

Posts.Content: Hi,  thanks for your info, I will be seing my oncologist next week and will ask questions again.   There are so many brand names for Tamoxifen and Letrozle I just want to get the one with the less bad effects. Wlll keep you updated on my decision. Thanks again Charlene70
Posts.Title: I am all mixed up - what's the difference between Letrozole and Tamoxifen...

Posts.Content: Hi there, Thanks for all this wonderful information.  Sure does help.  Have another question before I go see my pharmacist and my oncologist? Do you know if Tamoxifen has other brand names for it? Thanks for you help again, Charlene70 xx

Posts.Content: Hi Leolady56 So glad you gave us your advice.  You are always more than welcomed.   All info and advice from experienced people are more that welcomed. We are so new at all these cancer treatments.  Every little details help ease our mind. Thank again xxx Charlene70
